poem:
Title: "The Delicate Spectrum of Morality"

In the garden of life's quandaries,
where petals unfurl or stay clenched in bud,
there hangs the question of the clandestine seed,
stifled before its bloom.
Gentle healers, guardians of secret sorrows,
do not sing them to the law's early morning; 
instead, cradle the forbearance of empathy and liberty,
our tender birds against the world's cold iron.
